oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Original wills, Falk, Herman Daniel 1881
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An original will of Herman Daniel Falk, dated July 12th, 1881. Illustrates the full document. Falk’s beneficiaries include his father Michael Falk, sister, and his two nieces, Selma and Blanche. Falk states “[his] desire that the Mining Stock…shall not be disposed of until the death of [his] father and the consent of [his] nieces…obtained as this stock is paying a handsome dividend and becoming more valuable.” Falk further requests that a specific lot “also be held for some years” for the same reason. Falk appoints as executor his friend T.D. Flippin. Falk died in Alleghany Springs, Montgomery County, Virginia; his will was presented for probate in the Montgomery County Court on August 23rd, 1881. Per the State of Tennessee’s Wills and Inventories Book #26, the September Term Court in Davidson County found “to [its] satisfaction…that the foregoing instrument is duly authenticated.” Forms part of Record Group 16, Original Wills, 1780-1925.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Falk family; Flippin family
